exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type x : A Unable to unify "req ?M1764 ?M1764 ?M1764" with "exists c : A, (fun a : A => req a) c x x".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Type) (x : A), (rexists a : A, req a) x x

Premises:
Inductive req (A : Type) (a : A) : rel A A := req_intro : req a a a Arguments req {A}%type_scope Arguments req_intro {A}%type_scope
JMeq.JMeq_eq : forall (A : Type) (x y : A), JMeq.JMeq x y -> x = y
rel_all_1 : forall x : ?A, (rforall a : ?A, req a) x x -> forall a : ?A, req a x x where ?A : [ |- Type]
Operators_Properties.clos_rt_rtn1_iff : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x y : A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x y < -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 A R x y
Operators_Properties.clos_rtn1_rt : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x y : A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x y
Operators_Properties.clos_rt_rtn1 : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x y : A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 A R x y
req_rect : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> Type), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
req_rec : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> Set), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
req_ind : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
req_sind : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : A -> A -> SProp), P a a -> forall y y0 : A, req a y y0 -> P y y0
Ring_theory.pow_pos_swap : forall (R : Type) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rmul -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) -> forall (x : R) (j : BinNums.positive), req (rmul (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x j) x) (rmul x (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x j))
Coreflexive = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) => forall x y : A, R x y -> x = y : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop Arguments Coreflexive {A}%type_scope _%rel_scope
Inductive clos_refl_trans (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := rt_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x y | rt_refl : Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x x | rt_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans _%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.rt_step _%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.rt_refl _%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.rt_trans _%type_scope _%rel_scope
Inductive clos_refl_trans_n1 (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := rtn1_refl : Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 A R x x | rtn1_trans : forall y z : A, R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans_n1 _%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.rtn1_refl _%type_scope _%rel_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.rtn1_trans _%type_scope _%rel_scope
Inductive JMeq (A : Type) (x : A) : forall B : Type, B -> Prop := JMeq_refl : JMeq.JMeq x x Arguments JMeq.JMeq [A]%type_scope _ [B]%type_scope Arguments JMeq.JMeq_refl {A}%type_scope {x}, [A] _
Record ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_rt { Radd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; Radd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); Radd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); Rmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; Rmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); Rmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); Rdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z)); R...
nth_split : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A) (d : A), n < length l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, (l = l1 ++ nth n l d :: l2 /\ length l1 = n)%type
rel_ex_relim : forall (R : ?C -> rel ?A ?B) (x : ?A) (y : ?B) (P Q : Prop), (forall c : ?C, RElim (R c) x y P Q) -> RElim (rexists y, R y) x y P Q where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type] ?C : [ |- Type]
Relation_Definitions.Build_PER : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A), symmetric A R -> transitive A R -> Relation_Definitions.PER A R
rel_union = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => (R1 x y \/ R2 x y)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel A B -> rel A B Arguments rel_union {A B} (_ _)%rel_scope
rel_all = fun (A B C : Type) (R : C -> rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => forall c : C, R c x y : forall A B C : Type, (C -> rel A B) -> rel A B Arguments rel_all {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
BinNat.N.log2_up_eq_succ_is_pow2 : forall a : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.log2_up (BinNat.N.succ a) = BinNat.N.succ (BinNat.N.log2_up a) -> exists b : BinNums.N, a = BinNat.N.pow (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) b
req_rintro : forall a : ?A, RIntro True (req a) a a where ?A : [ |- Type]
rel_ex = fun (A B C : Type) (R : C -> rel A B) (x : A) (y : B) => exists c : C, R c x y : forall A B C : Type, (C -> rel A B) -> rel A B Arguments rel_ex {A B C}%type_scope _%function_scope
req_intro : forall a : ?A, req a a a where ?A : [ |- Type]
req_corefl : forall a : ?A, Coreflexive (req a) where ?A : [ |- Type]
rel_union_rexists_l : forall (R1 R2 : rel ?A ?B) (x : ?A) (y : ?B), RExists (R1 x y) (R1 \/ R2) x y where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]
QArith_base.Q_Setoid = {| Equivalence_Reflexive := fun x : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qeq_refl x; Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) => QArith_base.Qeq_sym x y H; Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : QArith_base.Q) (H : QArith_base.Qeq x y) (H0 : QArith_base.Qeq y z) => QArith_base.Qeq_trans x y z H H0 |} : Equivalence QArith_base.Qeq
BinInt.Z.double_bits_succ : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) a) (BinInt.Z.succ n) = BinInt.Z.testbit a n
BinInt.Z.double_bits : forall a n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.testbit (BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) a) n = BinInt.Z.testbit a (BinInt.Z.pred n)
QArith_base.Qeq_refl : forall x : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq x x
Build_PolarityResolved : forall (A B : Type) (R : rel A B), PolarityResolved R
QArith_base.Qeq_sym : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq x y -> QArith_base.Qeq y x
rel_all_relim : forall (R : ?C -> rel ?A ?B) (x : ?A) (y : ?B) (P Q : Prop), (exists c : ?C, RElim (R c) x y P Q) -> RElim (rforall y, R y) x y P Q where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type] ?C : [ |- Type]
BinInt.Z2Pos.id : forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 x -> BinNums.Zpos (BinInt.Z.to_pos x) = x
BinNat.N.leb_nle : forall x y : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.leb x y = false < -> ~ BinNat.N.le x y
QArith_base.Qeq_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq x y -> QArith_base.Qeq y z -> QArith_base.Qeq x z
Field_theory.Fdiv_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))
BinInt.Z2Pos.inj_pow : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 x -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 y -> BinInt.Z.to_pos (BinInt.Z.pow x y) = BinPos.Pos.pow (BinInt.Z.to_pos x) (BinInt.Z.to_pos y)
Record field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_field { F_R : Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req; F_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; Fdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); Finv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_field [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul rsub ropp]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
rel_ex_rintro : forall (R : ?C -> rel ?A ?B) (c : ?C) (m : ?A) (n : ?B), RExists (R c m n) (rexists y, R y) m n where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type] ?C : [ |- Type]

intros.
apply req_intro.
